message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper discusses Named Entity Recognition (NER) for news content distribution platform using BERT, CRF and Wikipedia. This falls under the sub-category of Natural Language Processing (NLP) which is covered in several arXiv CS sub-categories. However, given the focus on NER for news content, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. Additionally, the use of BERT and CRF suggests a focus on machine learning and deep learning, which could also place the paper in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of Wikipedia data for training the model suggests a focus on information retrieval, which could place the paper in sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper's focus on building better user recommendation and notification algorithms suggests a focus on reinforcement learning, which could place the paper in sub-category cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
